wikipedia_page.main: Albert Wood was a rugby union footballer who played in the 1880s. He played at representative level for England, and at club level for Halifax, as a forward, e.g. front row, lock, or back row. Prior to Tuesday 27 August 1895, Halifax was a rugby union club.

link_mentions.page: List of England national rugby union players

response: *Albert Wood (rugby union), rugby union footballer who played in the 1880s
* Albert Wood, won a cap for England (RU) while at Halifax in 1884 against Ireland
